editorialSummary.text: Modest rooms, some with balconies, in a utilitarian hotel offering a restaurant/bar & parking.

text.text:
I selected this resort based on the google reviews and various YouTube videos available about the resorts in Araku. Though this resort is run by APTDC, a government organization, this place is maintained well. The building is old and needs maintenance and beautification. But overall experience is very good. Tribal museum and coffee museum are at walking distance. The in house restaurant has specific timing for breakfast, lunch and dinner and breakfast is complimentary. The food is good, though not super-tasty. I would recommend eating from this restaurant as food outside may not be healthy and hygienic. And the best about this restaurant is the mini bar attached to this, where beer (only kingfisher) and few verities of liquor are available. The location is very ideal to spend with your family or friends. The balcony is very spacious and you can enjoy the view of the valley very well.

The management needs to repair the seepage issues and paint the whole hotel. Lift and Wi-Fi are required for the better comfort of guests. Otherwise, this is the best place to stay in Araku

text.text: I stayed in an AC room in 4th floor. The room and bathroom are pretty clean. The service is ok. There is no Lift which is a pretty big let down for a hotel of this size. The balcony is big and has pretty good valley view. You can get a campfire for 1500rs which is a bit costly which is provided by employees privately but the service is good.

The balcony is big and has pretty good valley view. You can get a campfire for 1500rs which is a bit costly which is provided by employees privately but the service is good.

text.text: Booked an A/c deluxe room here during 1st week of January. Room was good, balcony was bigger than necessary. Didn't order room service, used the restaurant in the ground floor. I don't think there is a lift here.

originalText.text: Booked an A/c deluxe room here during 1st week of January. Room was good, balcony was bigger than necessary. Didn't order room service, used the restaurant in the ground floor. I don't think there is a lift here.

text.text: The place where this hotel is situated has one of the best views in Araku. The hotel has a great architectural design and the Deluxe A/C rooms have the biggest balconies I have ever seen in a hotel offering great views of the nature. It also has a small garden where children can play and have fun. Overall, liked my stay here.

It also has a small garden where children can play and have fun. Overall, liked my stay here.

text.text: Quite resort. It's a govt owned property so the room services are not so great.  The food is ls also below par.  The location is great. Take the non AC room which comes with a big balcony. The resort also has a big get together place with camp fire facility. They charge extra for that

text.text: Rooms are quite spacious... But still I'm rating it 4 star cause the bathrooms aren't spacious enough.. Overall a good resort... They also have tennis courts and swimming pool.. They do have hot water facility at swimming pool.. So for me it's a big thumbs upüëç!!

editorialSummary.text: Unassuming rooms & suites in a low-key hotel offering a casual restaurant, plus breakfast & Wi-Fi.

text.text:
Sorry for such a delayed review...

We stayed here during the December Christmas holidays and i found this on google maps; read lot of reviews and finally booked this.

The location is ideal right on the Araku-Vizag highway!

Decent parking lot but gets cramped up very quickly - the main reason is the restaurant!

Room was below average but served our purpose; i wish i did not stay for 2 nights here but cannot help now!

The staff are OK but main USP is location and restaurant!

Me, wife, daughter and son stayed here for 2 nights.

They tried very hard to setup the place but still needs maintenance and trained staff!

Room service is OK; we got hot water but no TV nor any heater to beat the cold weather!

They also had bonfires and a projector setup on the 1st floor but not sure if it paid or free!

I will not go back but I do recommend you guys to please do try the stay here and add your pics/review so it is helpful for others!

text.text: I have reserved Casa Holiday Resort after reading google review and it was right decision. Location, Room, Service, Food all were excellent. Staff was always smiley. Manager Raju helped us by guiding as required. It was excellent stay. I will recommend anyone to book this place.

originalText.text: I have reserved Casa Holiday Resort after reading google review and it was right decision. Location, Room, Service, Food all were excellent. Staff was always smiley. Manager Raju helped us by guiding as required. It was excellent stay. I will recommend anyone to book this place.

text.text: Every aspect related to the Hotel was amazing. The food here was amazingly delicious and reasonable, there was a projector display on the terrace in evening, the rooms were clean with daily service and the staff were very courteous and responsive. I stayed here for 3 days straight. The staff - Chandu, Ramanna and Poorna were there at every step to guide us and make our stay a pleasant one. I highly recommend the stay.

originalText.text: Every aspect related to the Hotel was amazing. The food here was amazingly delicious and reasonable, there was a projector display on the terrace in evening, the rooms were clean with daily service and the staff were very courteous and responsive. I stayed here for 3 days straight. The staff - Chandu, Ramanna and Poorna were there at every step to guide us and make our stay a pleasant one. I highly recommend the stay.

text.text: This hotel is an average hotel. We booked from MakeMyTrip. The booking price was 4.5k. But got very average facilities. One one person was there at the front desk. He was working in a agile mode. He was doing all the work alone. I appreciate him. Room is not so big. We got room on the 1st floor. There was a big terrace. Morning breakfast was very good.

places.formattedAddress: Padmapuram, 8VQG+G3X, Araku Valley, Andhra Pradesh 531149, India
places.adrFormatAddress: Padmapuram, 8VQG+G3X, Araku Valley, Andhra Pradesh 531149, India

editorialSummary.text: Bright rooms in a casual resort offering a restaurant, a play area & a free train station shuttle.

text.text:
This resort is excellent in terms of location, ambience and service; though the way to enter the compound is clumsy, narrow and not very pleasant, but once you enter, it's really good with lots of greenery. Rooms are value for money, clean, spacious and comfortable. Service is also very good, you can call the reception for something and someone will come in a few minutes. Didn't enjoy the food much, but food items available there was mostly same everywhere out side also, so not much of a variety in taste or form ‚òπÔ∏è Don't expect north/east/west Indian food. The tea was nice though.

People visit in groups during weekends and holidays to party and enjoy in this ambience, and some of them played loud music late in the night, surprised to see there was no restriction. If you want to wander around in the night inside the compound, you will be annoyed by the loud music. Inside rooms, it was not much of a problem, though our rooms were a bit farther from the place where music was played.

Overall this will be an excellent stay for 1-2 days, I will recommend the resort, contact them also for Araku sight seeing, they have contacts with very friendly and professional car service providers.

Tip: Just left to the entrance of the resort entrance, there goes a narrow road that takes you up-hill. Take a walk if you wish üòâ it will be great experience walking up the hills and take a look around. Be safe around the rocks and cliffs, and come back to the resort while there is day light. We wandered this place by ourselves just out of curiosity. This area is not part of the resort's compound, so you have to ensure your own safety and you are on your own.

text.text:
Staff Behavior is worst. The response is good until you book rooms post you will not get any response. We faced lot of issues with staff and Rooms.

Note: They are charging extra money for everything except rooms.

Please find the charges requested, as part of facilities camp fire is mentioned but they asked money. As per initial discussion extra cot will be provided for 3rd person but they gave bed on floor. When I asked the same they demanded extra money. The response from the staff is very poor. We have to go 3 or 4 times for same thing. Initially they provided one room but in washrooms water is clogging, even after reporting to the reception no response. After 4 follow up they changed the room. The new room that provided doesn't have soap stand, broken sink and no holder for hand flush tap. When we informed these issues also no response from the team. Do you need any additional information?

text.text: We booked a month in advance and had a pleasant stay. Rooms are clean and spacious. The staffs are really good especially Shiva and Diwakar. The restaurant food is good l, but had limited breakfast option. The vegetarian stuffs were good and their prices are reasonable.  Just one disadvantage, the road that leads to the resort is not that great, you have open drainage on both sides,  around 200 to 300 metersl, post you enter you have a luxurious resort with ample parking. We had a wonderful stay and will visit again

text.text: The property is huge with good maintained ambiance. The garden has to be fully grown to fully enjoy it's view. Rooms are spacious with good balcony views. The property is located at a secluded area but not very far from the city. It will be a little challenging to find a good breakfast spot with seating ambiance near by as the property doesn't provide breakfast. Lunch and dinner were provided when informed earlier. But there is a huge communication gap between the restaurant and management staff. We are disappointed that we have to repeat our requests more times for fulfillments. Little things like hot water supply, dinning areas and room service after checking in should be taken care, else everything seemed decent.

text.text: Was here for a day and resort is lovely. Great view and resort interiors are good. Deluxe AC room is spacious. They charged for 3 people, however was charging money when asked for extra bed for the 3rd person, as the bed was queen size only. Hot water can be improved. Breakfast is not available here. No in room wifi, it is available only in the reception lobby.

Swimming pool is only for babies. Not enough depth and not for adults. No privacy to pool area.

Restaurant is unsatisfactory.

text.text: In every corner of this hotel, from its elegant rooms to its world-class amenities, there is a sense of magic and wonder that captivates the imagination and leaves a lasting impression. It is a place where dreams come true and memories are made, where every moment is infused with a sense of enchantment and delight. In conclusion, this hotel is not simply a place to stay; it is a destination in itself, where luxury, comfort, and unparalleled service come together to create an experience that is truly unforgettable. So indulge your senses, escape the ordinary, and discover the magic of this extraordinary hotel.

text.text:
My stay at Nature Nest's Resort in Araku Valley was nothing short of delightful. Situated conveniently on the main road, the resort offers easy access to all the nearby tourist attractions. The comfortable accommodation provided a perfect retreat after exploring the scenic beauty of Araku.

One standout feature is the resort's accessibility to various tourist spots, making it a strategic choice for travelers. Additionally, the option for camping, albeit at an extra cost, adds an adventurous touch to the stay. The well-maintained facilities and courteous staff contribute to a hassle-free and enjoyable experience.

Overall, Nature Nest's Resort is a good choice for those seeking a comfortable and well-connected stay in the heart of Araku Valley. I would recommend it for anyone looking to combine tranquility with accessibility during
their visit to this picturesque destination.

text.text: Location was really beautiful, hotel staff were good.really loved it. Food is not available here, we need to go 3km to araku valley to get food. Food is also nice there. Finally five star rating.

text.text: This so-called Resort is located just close to the Railway Track which is mostly used for goods trains so at night every hour  you will listen to the  train horn. During my stay the room was not very clean, Bedsheet was spotted. Standard rooms and washrooms are compact.Food quality is just average with very limited options. The owner lady's behaviour is very rude.

text.text: It is okay. The rooms are big but a bit old. The room service is nice but the restaurant is not. If you are expecting good South Indian pure veg food it is not available(To be fair it is a general problem in Araku and you at least have pure veg food). The resort is close to the main road and near our room we could see the train track (not sure if you can see it from other rooms but you can walk to the train track)and take photos when the train passes by. Overall I recommend you to go to other resorts if you can.

text.text: Prakruthi Resorts in Araku Valley often receives positive reviews for its serene ambiance, beautiful surroundings, and comfortable accommodation options. Visitors appreciate the resort's picturesque location amidst nature, offering a peaceful escape from city life. The property typically features well-maintained cottages or rooms, providing a cozy stay for guests. The resort's staff is usually friendly and attentive, contributing to a pleasant experience for visitors. Additionally, some reviewers highlight the delicious local cuisine served at the resort. However, occasional feedback might mention maintenance issues or suggest improvements in certain amenities. Overall, Prakruthi Resorts is favored by many for its tranquil setting and a relaxing stay amid the scenic beauty of Araku Valley.

text.text: Had lunch here only. Lunch was served fresh and was very good. Biriyani was decent. Bamboo chicken was good and could have been better.

text.text: Loot loot loot. This is in Araku Valley and every precious site is far away from this location. Think once before booking room in Araku valley. I suggest to book a room in Ananthagiri . Here Rooms are well maintained and ambience is good. Out of this everything is bad. Prices are too high. They cant provide two extra beds in a room instead they will tell us to book extra room. Very arrogant. For a two or three members it is a good choice. But 4 or 5 members it is not a good choice. Hotel and inside and outside looks exactly in the photos they shared in the site. Good location.

text.text:
Hi!
This is the worst resort I have seen, and I request those who are reading this review to stay away from this resort. We made a booking through MMT and paid money online 3 days before our arrival for a suite room. But after traveling from Hyderabad almost 900km when we reached, we found that they had sold that room to someone else. We asked the manager, and he simply told us what we would do with the room, and that was not required of us. And they just bluntly told us that we should take the refund and search room somewhere else. Or they can give us a non-ac room where we can stay.
And that manager was like this is an option do whatever you want to we don't care kind of attitude.
So, if you wanna ruined your holidays or stay this is best hell to stay.
